column4: Can someone help me? In terminal every time I run a command Fontconfig errors pop up
try another tab or close the termianal and reopen a new terminal session :)
I'd think some prior running lost/zombie process
No it has been happening all week even when the computer is shutting down I am getting a list of font config errors rather then the shutdown splash
can you paste it for use to see?    pastie.org or paste2.com or so
will do
http://pastie.org/966857
http://pastie.org/966857 the error I am getting
saw it :)
sounds as if it there's an error in /etc/fonts/fonts.conf :|
How do I fix it?
check your /etc/fonts/fonts.conf, maybe you have a missing <cachedir> entry, in mine is on line 73
will do
the line is not there
mine looks like -> http://paste2.org/p/837301
I am missing Huge Chunks of what is in your Fonts.conf
just bear in mind mine is for 9.1 :)
in other words don't cut, paste and save :P ,Is there any way to restore mine
well, you can always try to do the cut/paste, just back yours up :)
I will try that :S
Thank you for your help, I fixed the problem by adding the <cachedir> lines from yours to mine
